summary: This document contains notes from a November 12, 2021 video teleconference (VTC) preparation session for trial testimony involving an individual referred to as 'DR'. The notes indicate DR was shown several government exhibits (GX) and confirmed recognition of them, and provided clarifying statements about Jeffrey Epstein's travel patterns and pilot communications in the late 1990s.

persons.name: Attorney Quigley
persons.context: Appears to be the attorney conducting or involved in the VTC preparation session for trial testimony.

connections.description: Attorney Quigley appears to be preparing DR for trial testimony, indicating a legal professional relationship.
DR is providing testimony and clarifying statements about Jeffrey Epstein's activities, travel, and operations.

events.title: VTC Trial Testimony Preparation
events.description: A video teleconference preparation session for trial testimony where witness DR was shown government exhibits and asked to provide clarifying statements.

events.title: Epstein's USVI Travel Pattern Begins
events.description: DR believes Jeffrey Epstein started traveling to the US Virgin Islands most weekends around 1998.

keyFacts: A witness (DR) was being prepared for trial testimony in November 2021 regarding the Epstein case.
The witness confirmed recognition of several government exhibits (GX-113, GX-114, GX-112, GX-327, GX-HO, GX-12).
The witness stated that around 1998, Jeffrey Epstein began traveling to the US Virgin Islands most weekends.
The witness recalled that Epstein's pilots initially used beepers for flight notifications, later transitioning to cell phones.
